sentence.Network_en: There is another avenue to pursue — it involves further negotiations.
sentence.Network_cn: 还有一个办法可用，但需要进一步的磋商。

sentence.Network_en: It might give the Commission undue influence over the coming negotiations.
sentence.Network_cn: 这可能会在即将开启的谈判问题上给委员会带来过多的影响。

sentence.Network_en: Some managers have recently raised objection to the PFA handling these negotiations.
sentence.Network_cn: 一些主教练最近就英格兰职业足球运动员协会负责这些谈判提出了异议。

this year , the negotiations have been particularly tortuous as China , the world's biggest-ore consumer , squared off avon gold with heavyweight miners in hopes of getting a discount of 40 % .今年的谈判进程尤为曲折，作为世界最大的铁矿石消费国，中国摆出了要与铁矿石龙头企业一争高下的架势，以期能够将铁矿石合同价在去年
how would you like to the negotiations ., 你认为该怎样来进行这次谈判呢.

entry.tran: (尤指商业或政治方面的)谈判，协商，磋商
entry.def: Negotiations are formal discussions between people who have different aims or intentions, especially in business or politics, during which they try to reach an agreement.

example.ex: We have had meaningful negotiations and I believe we are very close to a deal...
example.tran: 我们已进行了有益的磋商，我相信我们很快能成交。

example.ex: After 10 years of negotiation, the Senate ratified the strategic arms reduction treaty.
example.tran: 经过10年协商，参议院已经正式批准了《削减战略武器条约》。

Sentence.sentence: Annan stressed the need for the negotiations to focus on increasing the flow of money from rich to poor regions to help reduce their vulnerability to climate hazards while still curbing the emissions of the heat-trapping gases.
The actor type works better in tough negotiations.
He failed in his negotiations with the Africans.
